name: Hotel Mercure Leblon

reviews.text: The service is quite below international level, as usual for Rio. And it's an Accor Mercure. The room has a bathroom with no windows or ventilation. It smells bad.
reviews.title: Bad service: too expensive despite well localized

reviews.text: The management said they are changing all plumbing and elevators, but I don't think it will solve the smell.
reviews.title: BEST LOCATION AND SOMETHING ELSE!

reviews.text: Regarding elevators, there is no service one, so me and my family had to stay once with garbage, other times with hotel people full of boxes or minibar stuff. Just ugly.
reviews.title: Another Rio de Janeiro rip-off
Good hotel in good location shame about the poor common areas.
reviews.text: It's good to stay near the beach, so I didn't care about the 80's decoration style.
I have been staying at this hotel for over a month now. What can I say?
reviews.title: Great location. The rest....not so much
not a "comfort-first" kind of hotel, but one thing: location
reviews.text: - fantastic location, close to the beach, shopping mall, restaurants, bus stop etc
we were a group of 4 adults. stayed in a 2 bed suite, which consisted of a livinig room, small kitchenete, dining area, twin bedroom, shower room, double bed with ensute shower.
reviews.title: Location & Practicality

reviews.text: great location; 2 blocks from leblon beach, lots of restaurants & shops, the nearest supermarket is called pao de asucar about 3 blocks away. most importantly this is a safe area in rio.
reviews.title: Very Central but only 40% of the rooms belong to the hotel..many strangers!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for two nights with my wife. The hotel is well located if you want the beach and shopping, but Leblon isn't that good if you want to go e.g. to Christ or Sugar Loaf, and the metro hasn't got there yet.
reviews.title: Agree with previous posters

reviews.text: Didn't have great expectations after reading older comments here. We liked the cleanliness and the attitude of the staff, plus the size of the room (it's an apartment). But:
reviews.title: Good location- but that's it

aka: Mercure Apartments Rio De Janeiro Leblon Hotel
description: The Mercure Leblon hotel is located in one of Rio's most charming districts, close to Antero de Quental square and Ataulfo de Paiva and Bartolemeu Mitre avenues. It is surrounded by various bars, restaurants and shops, in addition to the Rio Design and Leblon shopping centers.*We would like to inform guests that the hotel will be undergoing renovation work on apartments, communal areas, elevators and pipework until March 2014.
